intro: Calycogonium calycopteris, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive calyx that remains attached to the fruit. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Calycogonium calycopteris produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
